creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
apr_os_locale_encoding calls GetThreadLocale which is not supported under
Windows CE and does not expect Unicode strings.  The attached patch will call
GetUserDefaultLCID() instead of GetThreadLocale() when built for WinCE and will
compact the returned unicode digits to ASCII.  It should result in no change to
the generated code for Windows since TCHAR should be typedef'd as char and
_UNICODE should not be set.

creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 18495
Patch to allow method to compile under WinCE

There appear to be no unit tests for either of the methods in charset.c.  I
rolled	a simple one for my own testing and checked that it returned the
expected value under WinCE.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: Mass reassign the 44 open apr-bugs to apr bug list

creator: davi@apache.org
text: It compiles and builds fine on VS C++ 6.0

creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 20093
Update of previous patch

Same content as previous patch, but this one is based from the apr directory
and might have different line feeds.  Kept getting rejections of previous patch
unless I upped fuzz level.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
committed as 543313.  The patch raises the point that we are using ansi calls
on winnt, but I'm leaving well enough alone, for the moment.
